attributes.action: Stop Pay Rises for MPs, until NHS workers are offered more than 1%
attributes.additional_details: We owe a debt to all Front Line NHS workers who have maintained our NHS and managed to greatly assist in treating sufferers of this awful Covid virus and keeping the NHS going. The Budget announced a !% pay rise for those staff, even though the rest of the public services are on a Pay Freeze. When it comes to the Parliamentary debate on MPs pay,  will award themselves substantially more than 1%? I believe in no Pay Rises for MPs until there Front-Line NHS workers are offered substantially more
attributes.background: We the undersigned believe that if the UK Government insist on restricting the pay rise of front-line NHS workers to merely 1%, in the time when they have been the corner stone of this Counties fight against Covid, then all MPs should forfeit their own right to a pay rise for the next three years.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. The Independent Parliamentary Standards Authority (IPSA) is responsible for deciding on MPs' expenses and pay. IPSA is independent of both Parliament and Government.

You can find out how to contact IPSA here:
http://www.theipsa.org.uk/about-us/contact-us/

You might like to sign the following petitions:

Please give the NHS Covid Heroes a bigger pay rise.
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/577970

Recognise all members of NHS nursing profession by giving them a 12.5% pay rise
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/560253

Pay 15% bonus to public facing NHS staff
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/570762
